name: Jane Doe
subject: Calculus I

reviews.text: Great teacher, explains concepts clearly. Her lectures are well-organized and she provides excellent examples.
Fair exams, good pacing. Office hours are very helpful for understanding difficult concepts.
Best math professor I've had. Makes calculus actually understandable.

bio: PhD in Mathematics from MIT. Research in numerical methods and pedagogy. Known for clear explanations and fair grading.

name: Tom Green
subject: Linear Algebra

reviews.text: Very theoretical approach. Tough grader but you learn a lot.
Assignments are challenging but fair. Need to attend every lecture.
Hard class but worth it if you want to really understand linear algebra.

bio: PhD in Pure Mathematics. Focus on abstract algebra and linear algebra theory. Emphasizes rigorous mathematical thinking.

name: Sarah Johnson
subject: Data Structures

reviews.text: Excellent at explaining complex algorithms. Uses great real-world examples.
Projects are challenging but she provides good feedback. Very approachable.
Best CS professor for understanding data structures and algorithms.

bio: PhD in Computer Science from Stanford. Industry experience at Google. Specializes in algorithms and data structures.

name: Mike Davis
subject: General Physics I

reviews.text: Makes physics interesting with great demonstrations. Tests are fair.
Very patient during office hours. Explains concepts multiple ways.
Good balance of theory and practical applications. Recommends great resources.

bio: PhD in Physics from Caltech. Research in quantum mechanics. Known for engaging lectures and clear explanations.

name: Lisa Chen
subject: Organic Chemistry

reviews.text: Best chemistry professor ever! Makes organic chem actually make sense.
Incredibly clear explanations. Office hours are always packed but worth the wait.
Tough subject but she makes it manageable. Great study guides and practice problems.

bio: PhD in Organic Chemistry from Harvard. Published researcher with focus on synthesis. Passionate about teaching.

name: Robert Wilson
subject: Creative Writing

reviews.text: Really inspiring teacher. Gives constructive feedback on writing.
Flexible with deadlines and understanding of creative process.
Great workshops and peer review sessions. Improved my writing significantly.

bio: MFA in Creative Writing. Published author of three novels. Focuses on narrative structure and character development.

name: Amanda Taylor
subject: Introduction to Psychology

reviews.text: Makes psychology fascinating with real-world examples and case studies.
Very engaging lecturer. Tests are fair and based on lectures and readings.
Great intro to psychology. Really made me consider majoring in psych.

bio: PhD in Clinical Psychology. Research focus on cognitive behavioral therapy. Excellent at making complex concepts accessible.

name: David Brown
subject: Microeconomics

reviews.text: Very thorough coverage of material. Demanding but fair.
Knows his stuff but can be dry. Need to stay focused in class.
Challenging course but you really learn economics. Good preparation for advanced courses.

bio: PhD in Economics from University of Chicago. Research in microeconomic theory and market behavior.

name: Emily Clark
subject: Molecular Biology

reviews.text: Very passionate about biology, makes the material engaging.
Good at explaining tough concepts like DNA replication.
Sometimes fast-paced, but overall great professor.

bio: PhD in Biology from UC Berkeley. Research in molecular genetics and gene regulation.

name: James White
subject: World History

reviews.text: Great storyteller, makes history come alive.
Exams are tough, but fair if you keep up with readings.
Really broad perspective on world events, inspiring.

bio: PhD in History. Specializes in global history and comparative empires.

name: Sophia Martinez
subject: International Relations

reviews.text: Uses real-world events to explain theories. Very engaging.
Class debates are amazing and thought-provoking.
Sometimes loads of reading, but worth it.

bio: PhD in Political Science. Research in international conflict and diplomacy.

name: Mark Evans
subject: Social Theory

reviews.text: Challenging but makes you think critically.
A lot of reading, but discussions are rewarding.
Really helped me see society differently.

bio: PhD in Sociology. Research in social inequality and cultural studies.

name: Hannah Lee
subject: Ethics

reviews.text: Explains philosophical concepts clearly. Great discussion leader.
Really fair grader, cares about students' arguments.
Made me fall in love with philosophy.

bio: PhD in Philosophy. Specializes in moral philosophy and applied ethics.

name: Daniel Nguyen
subject: Art History

reviews.text: Very passionate about art, lectures are full of visuals.
Knows a ton about art history, but exams are detailed.
Inspiring lectures, really makes you appreciate art.

bio: PhD in Art History. Research in Renaissance and modern art movements.

name: Rachel Smith
subject: Marketing Principles

reviews.text: Brings real-world marketing experience into class.
Projects are challenging but rewarding.
One of the best business professors here.

bio: MBA from Wharton. Former marketing director at a Fortune 500 company.

name: John Kim
subject: Electrical Circuits

reviews.text: Very technical, expects students to work hard.
Knows the material deeply, exams are fair but tough.
Good labs, challenging lectures.

bio: PhD in Electrical Engineering. Research in circuits and signal processing.

name: Olivia Walker
subject: Foundations of Education

reviews.text: Very supportive and motivating, really cares about future teachers.
Brings real classroom examples into lectures.
Makes you feel prepared for teaching.

bio: PhD in Education. Research in pedagogy and teacher training.

name: Alex Patel
subject: Medical-Surgical Nursing

reviews.text: Very compassionate and knowledgeable. Teaches with care.
Clinical sessions are extremely useful. Great mentor.
One of the best professors in the nursing program.

bio: MSN, RN. Experienced clinical nurse educator with focus on patient care and safety.
